data.name: Find Fibonacci last digit (hardcore+custom)
data.description:
Find the last digit of the fibonacci of the Nth term.

The fibonacci array is [1,1,2,3,5,8,13,21,...], where each term is the sum of the previous two.

You now have a custom array which is fibonacci style, being [X,Y,X+Y,X+2Y,2X+3Y,3X+5Y]...

Input: N X Y

Output: A single digit, the last digit of the fibonacci of the Nth term.

NOTE THAT NUMBERS ARE HUGE AND THAT YOU NEED TO USE 64 BIT INTEGERS (long long in C++) TO PASS

Constraints:

Sample

0<N<10^3 X,Y=1

Subtask 1

0<N<10^3 0<X,Y<100 X<=Y

Subtask 2

0<N<10^16 0<X,Y<10^3

Slightly easier kata (6kyu) https://www.codewars.com/kata/56b7771481290cc283000f28

Edit: Python now supported
